content:
# We have successfully gathered another 10 units of copper ore, bringing our total to 10 copper ore in the inventory. 
# The first furnace has produced 13 iron plates, while the second furnace is actively working on 6 units of copper ore and has produced 8 copper plates so far.

# Since the copper furnace is still processing, we should check the status of the copper plates again. 
# We can insert the additional copper ore we just gathered into the copper furnace to ensure it has enough resources to continue production.

# Let's insert the gathered copper ore into the copper furnace and monitor the smelting process.
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, furnace_copper, quantity=10)  # Insert the new copper ore into the copper furnace

# After inserting the copper ore, we will check the inventory and the status of the entities again.
print(f"Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after inserting more copper ore into the furnace.")  # Check inventory after inserting

# We will wait for a maximum of 30 seconds to see if we can gather more copper plates from the furnace.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time for smelting
    if inspect_inventory(furnace_copper)[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 2:  # Check if we have at least 2 copper plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Copper smelting timeout - check inputs.")

# Finally, we should check the inventory and the status of the entities again.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after smelting copper plates.")  # Final inventory check
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()} after smelting copper plates.")  # Check entity status again.
